God in Christ has reached out to the farthest edges

tekstueel_bewijs: that presence of God in the highest places

zender.identificatie: The Triune God / The Biblical Revelation
tekstueel_bewijs: The heart of the whole biblical revelation is that God has come

helper.identificatie: Jesus Christ / The Incarnation / The Cross
tekstueel_bewijs: God in Christ has said to a criminal

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The preacher/believer's mandate to declare this everywhereness to the world.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Preacher/Church
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: Because God is everywhere (Program 1), the preacher is empowered to speak until the work is finished (Program 2).

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on God's 'ability' and 'power' to be present and to save, rather than the hearer's 'obligation' to perform.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from the fear of lack of privacy (S1/Not-S1) to the terror of Hell (S2), then resolves in the 'Everywhereness' (Not-S2) which is revealed as Grace (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved through the Incarnation: God occupies S2 (Hell) so that the Receiver is never outside S1.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. Hell is described as 'filth', 'foulness', and 'degradation'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is profoundly theocentric. God is the primary actor (Subject) who initiates the movement toward the human object. Even human sin and 'making one's bed in hell' are met by God's active presence.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: It is something that we all ought to take to heart.

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He scoops us up out of degradation.
He has condescended to wear as his cloak the corruption of our humanity.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures like Adam or the criminal on the cross are used as recipients of God's action, not as moral examples to follow.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: the criminal is the object of Christ's promise.

identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic grace; God's presence is not contingent on human merit.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon maintains a tight focus on the attribute of God (Omnipresence) as a soteriological reality.
spanning_punten: The transition from the 'arrogance of race' to the 'filth of hell' is slightly abrupt but linked by the theme of God's sovereignty.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He has made common cause with our weakness... descended into hell.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit is the 'Everywhereness' that confronts and comforts.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Severe; described as 'corruption' and 'brothels of the soul'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative structure is soundly theocentric. God is the Subject of almost all transformative verbs.

modale_balans.voorgestelde_balans: Maintain as is; this is a sermon of assurance.
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The sermon successfully avoids the 'Devoir' trap.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: The opponent (Hell/Sin) is already treated with cosmic seriousness.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Soteriology (God's presence) correctly precedes and grounds the Ethics (the preacher's call to speak).

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in maintaining God as the Subject. It avoids moralism by transforming a potentially terrifying attribute (omnipresence) into the ultimate ground of grace.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: A rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'wings of the morning' metaphor; Greimas shows that God is the one providing the 'wings' or meeting the one who flies.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains Psalm 139; Greimas shows how the sermon re-actualizes the Psalm's actants for a modern Richmond audience.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Everywhereness' is not a static concept but an active Subject (God) pursuing a passive Object (Man).

volledige_subject_lijst: God (has come, has gotten down, has condescended)
volledige_object_lijst: The soul in the arctic region
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Doberman pinscher' anecdote to mock human 'Vouloir' (willingness) as a prerequisite for God's presence.
